title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 16 March 2015 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has quit  
00:13 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:22 <martin-h> has joined #xwiki

06:03 <Denis1> has quit

07:51 <mflorea> has quit  
08:20 <cjd> has quit  
08:25 <Inge-> has quit

08:51 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:00 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <lucaa> has quit  
09:23 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
09:57 <vmassol> good morning guys  
09:58 <cjd> gm  
09:58 <vmassol> so today is our 7.0RC1 release  
09:58 <cjd> shiny  
09:58 <vmassol> tmortagne: you're the RM :)  
09:58 <vmassol> also I think we should release 6.4.3 ASAP too  
09:59 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <vmassol> for 6.4.3 there's still an issue for guillaume to fix this morning  
10:04 <vmassol> so releasing 6.4.3 this week would be good  
10:07 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:25 <tmortagne> I have to finish something before the release (almost done moving repository test to platform)  
10:27 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <mflorea> has quit  
10:32 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
11:35 <tmortagne> Enygma`: Watchlist is still failing with "Rule violated for bundle XWiki Platform - WatchList - API: instructions covered ratio is 0.05, but expected minimum is 0.06"  
11:42 <Enygma`> tmortagne: yes. I will add some tests today.  
12:06 <tmortagne> please guys move issues that' you won't have time to do in 7.0RC1, especially mflorea1 and Enygma`who have a lot of jira issues assigned  
12:07 <mflorea1> tmortagne: I need a little more time to finish XWIKI-11506  
12:08 <tmortagne> mflorea1: sure, just want to have a clearer view on what is blocking 7.0RC1  
12:10 <tmortagne> mflorea1: a "new feature" that was not done in RC1 should probably be moved to 7.1M1 instead of 7.0 final  
12:12 <vfzevaze> has joined #xwiki  
12:12 <mflorea1> right  
12:12 <vfzevaze> hi there!  
12:12 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:29 <tmortagne> Enygma`: the line about Watchlist plugin should probably go in http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki70RC1#HDeprecatedandRetiredprojects instead of Miscellaneous  
12:29 <Enygma`> I thought we only put there stuff we move to contrib  
12:30 <Enygma`> I added the same thing in the migration section  
12:30 <tmortagne> "Deprecated and Retired projects"  
12:30 <tmortagne> so both from what I understand  
12:30 <Enygma`> ok then  
12:30 <vfzevaze> I am creating a new extension (https://github.com/4F2E4A2E/macro-hpqc) to fetch data from HPQC (Ticketsystem from HP) and present them in xwiki. I do not know how to package the project which consist of a groovy class and unit test, macro cmls and a java class. The project is on github, can someone please take a look an help me get this baby wraped  
12:30 <vfzevaze>  up?  
12:32 <tmortagne> vfzevaze: what you did in https://github.com/4F2E4A2E/macro-hpqc generally looks like the way to go, is there something not working ?  
12:34 <vfzevaze> well the thing is, the groovy class works on my eclipse, but how do i call the groovy class in my macro and how do i deploy this? since there is a java dependency.  
12:34 <vfzevaze> i could not find any information in the xar package refering to its java dependecy  
12:34 <tmortagne> groovy script generally goes in wiki pages  
12:34 <vfzevaze> or does maven the work for me? i dont ave a clue  
12:35 <tmortagne> and you indicate in your application the jar you depends on  
12:35 <tmortagne> there is nothing special about XAR package and dependencies  
12:35 <vfzevaze> you mean the param for running groovy i get that  
12:35 <tmortagne> you do as for any other maven module  
12:36 <tmortagne> for the groovy script it all depends how you plan to use it once in the wiki  
12:36 <vfzevaze> i imagine it like this, someone want to install this macro using the extension manager, the user click install and the dependency and macro will be installed...  
12:36 <tmortagne> could be some resource in a jar, a script in a page, I can't really tell you since I don't know how you will use it  
12:37 <tmortagne> extension manager follow maven dependencies  
12:37 <vfzevaze> i will have a groovy script creating a new object from a separeted groovy class  
12:37 <tmortagne> so the user will ask to install your application and the jar will be installed too  
12:37 <vfzevaze> and that class uses functions from a java class  
12:37 <vfzevaze> that's it  
12:38 <tmortagne> ok but that still does not tell me who is supposed to call your groovy script :)  
12:38 <vfzevaze> but how does the extension manager know about it?  
12:38 <vfzevaze> the wiki page will  
12:38 <vfzevaze> on rendering the page using {{groovy}}  
12:38 <tmortagne> vfzevaze: you declare dependencies in https://github.com/4F2E4A2E/macro-hpqc/blob/master/xwiki-hpqc-macro-application/pom.xml  
12:38 <tmortagne> that's how EM knows it  
12:38 <vfzevaze> aaah  
12:39 <tmortagne> all you need now is to deploy all that in a maven/xwiki repository  
12:40 <vfzevaze> ok, thx, so i \_do\_ have to pass the jar param in the wiki page when using the groovy script?  
12:40 <vfzevaze> if so, what about the groovy dependency? the groovy files are not beeing package anywhere...  
12:41 <tmortagne> no you don't have to pass anything  
12:41 <tmortagne> if the jar is installed it will be in the classpath  
12:41 <tmortagne> and the groovy script will find it  
12:41 <vfzevaze> so the groovy scripts will be in the jar you say?  
12:42 <tmortagne> no  
12:42 <tmortagne> the jar will be in the classpath so from the groovy script point of view executed in some wiki page it will like using any JVM class  
12:43 <tmortagne> i.e. there is nothing to do, the jar will just be there  
12:43 <vfzevaze> ok, then i don't know how the groovy script in a wiki page can access a groovy class dependency when it is not inside the xml or jar  
12:44 <tmortagne> vfzevaze: I don't understand you use case  
12:44 <tmortagne> your groovy script use what exactly ?  
12:44 <tmortagne> do you mean you have two groovy scripts ?  
12:44 <vfzevaze> on a wiki page the user inserts a macro  
12:45 <tmortagne> one with a class and nother using that class ?  
12:45 <tmortagne> s/nother/another/  
12:45 <vfzevaze> this macro contains a small groovy script creating a object inside a groovy class (.groovy)  
12:45 <vfzevaze> doing e.g.: new HPQCMacro(param1, param2)  
12:45 <tmortagne> where is that class defined ?  
12:46 <vfzevaze> and that groovy class is using a java dependency  
12:46 <vfzevaze> as simple as that  
12:46 <tmortagne> not that simple it seems :)  
12:46 <vfzevaze> https://github.com/4F2E4A2E/macro-hpqc/blob/master/xwiki-hpqc-macro-api/src/main/groovy/org/xwiki/hpqc/api/HPQCMacro.groovy  
12:46 <vfzevaze> did not meant it this way, sorry  
12:47 <tmortagne> ok so from java point of view that's just some file that happen to be named "HPQCMacro.groovy"  
12:47 <tmortagne> no way to make it directly a Java class instead ? would make it much easier to reuse  
12:48 <tmortagne> if that's the only thing your jar contains putting that in a jar is actually useless  
12:48 <vfzevaze> if no other way possible i will have to do exactly that  
12:48 <tmortagne> there is other ways  
12:48 <tmortagne> that one is the easiest to reuse and also the best for performances  
12:48 <vfzevaze> i guess it was the wrong path conding a class in groovy, though it was so easy  
12:48 <tmortagne> another way is to put your class in another page and include that page  
12:49 <vfzevaze> please be so kind and provide an example or link on how i could achieve that  
12:51 <tmortagne> you put the class in a {{groovy}} macro in some page and you use the {{include reference="MyGoovyClass"/}} in the page where you have your other groovy script script (before the actually {{groovy}} script)  
12:52 <tmortagne> if will pretty much behave as if you have one bug script with the groovy class and the part using that class  
12:52 <vfzevaze> thx alot!  
12:52 <tmortagne> but it mean it will reparse your class each time you script is used  
12:52 <tmortagne> that's why I was suggesting to put that in pure Java  
12:53 <tmortagne> at least the good thing of putting everything in wiki page is that you will only have one package  
12:53 <vfzevaze> it's ugly i know, i will refactor / recode it in java  
12:53 <vfzevaze> though is good to have an option  
12:53 <vfzevaze> asap i would like to move this project to the xwiki-contrib  
12:54 <tmortagne> that's unless Groovy engine has some special way of searching for \*.groovy resources located in jar file but I don't think so (but I'm not a groovy expert)  
12:54 <vfzevaze> even so the groovy classes are not beeing packaged in any way  
12:56 <vfzevaze> as always a great xwiki community! thanks again and have i nice day sir! ;)  
12:57 <tmortagne> you're welcome, always happy to help for contributions ;)  
13:22 <DarkKnightCZ1> has joined #xwiki  
13:25 <lucaa> has quit  
13:42 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
13:48 <vfzevaze> has left #xwiki  
13:50 <vmassol> msmeria: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11927 only started with XWiki 7.0M2?  
13:50 <vmassol> (it's not there in 6.4.x for example?)  
13:50 <vmassol> because if that's the case then it's a blocker  
13:51 <msmeria> vmassol: hello  
13:51 <msmeria> I've only tested it on M2  
13:51 <msmeria> I'll take a look at 6.4.2 now  
13:51 <vmassol> thanks  
14:00 <Slashman\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:01 <msmeria> vmassol: the bug also affects 6.4.2  
14:04 <Slashman> has quit  
14:05 <vmassol> ok thanks  
14:11 <msmeria> vmassol: bad news: the bug also affects 6.2.7  
14:11 <vmassol> ok, makes sense  
14:12 <vmassol> note that the supported version for 6.x cycle is 6.4.x s  
14:12 <vmassol> s/6.4.x s/6.4.x  
14:12 <vmassol> so it would be nice to have it fixed for 6.4.3 which we need to release this week  
14:15 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:20 <Slashman\_> has quit  
14:20 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: we still don't have javadoc support in extensions on e.x.o right (for the Repository app)?  
14:24 <tmortagne> vmassol: there is no real generic way of supporting javadoc at Repository app level, that would probably be a e.x.o. special thing when matching nexus.xwiki.org  
14:25 <tmortagne> unless you mean something else  
14:36 <Pbas> Hello, I'm unable to edit http://extensions.xwiki.org pages (even my own http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Reinit\_Sandbox). Is it normal?  
14:36 <Trefex> has quit  
14:37 <Pbas> I wanted add an ajax example on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Output+JSON page  
14:39 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <Trefex> has quit  
14:41 <tmortagne> Pbas: what happen ? you don't have the edit button ?  
14:41 <Pbas> yes I haven't edit button  
14:41 <tmortagne> ok checking rights  
14:41 <vmassol> tmortagne: I mean offering a way for our users to see the javadoc for each extension  
14:41 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
14:42 <vmassol> maven supports a javadoc tag  
14:43 <vmassol> (actually not javadocà  
14:43 <vmassol> )  
14:43 <tmortagne> I don't know any javadoc tag  
14:43 <vmassol> <url>  
14:43 <tmortagne> you have javadoc file for extensions in which it makes sense  
14:43 <vmassol> but  
14:43 <vmassol> if we can find the URL in the maven repo for the arifact we can also get it for the javadoc  
14:43 <vmassol> \*artifact  
14:44 <tmortagne> <url> is not supposed to be the javadoc, its just the project website  
14:44 <vmassol> yes  
14:45 <vmassol> so forget this one  
14:45 <Denis> <url> is used already to target e.x.o  
14:46 <tmortagne> not really <url> but yes <url> is not imported since e.x.o. put itself as reference website  
14:46 <Pbas> FYI, It is a right access problem because http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/Extension/Reinit\_Sandbox return "You are not allowed to view this document or perform this action."  
14:46 <Denis> in EM, you use it to target e.x.o, no ?  
14:47 <tmortagne> Denis: there is different things  
14:47 <tmortagne> vmassol is talking about extension importer here  
14:47 <Denis> yep, I kno  
14:47 <Denis> w  
14:47 <tmortagne> and the importer does not take into account what is in <url>  
14:47 <tmortagne> because the extension page URL is used instead  
14:48 <Denis> what I try to say is that url is also used by javadoc for inter-module links !  
14:48 <tmortagne> at maven level  
14:48 <Denis> and actually, I have tricked the WebHome of e.x.o so that it make intelligent redirection  
14:48 <tmortagne> but anyway the point is that e can't use that property to find the javadoc  
14:49 <Denis> since inter-module link was totally broken  
14:49 <Denis> I know, it do not use it  
14:49 <Denis> It finding Javadoc is not so trivial  
14:50 <Denis> s/it/and  
14:50 <Denis> and the url is useless for that  
14:51 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
14:51 <Denis> but, <url> has a real impact on the javadoc generated  
14:52 <tmortagne> in a clean generic way it's not easy yes, we could cover a lot of extensions by nexus.xwiki.org in the matching the source repository (which is stored by the importer) and build a nexus URL to the javadoc if the extension is of type jar  
14:52 <Trefex> has quit  
14:52 <tmortagne> but as I said that would be a e.x.o. thing, not a Repository app thing  
14:52 <tmortagne> s/by nexus.xwiki.org in the matching/by matching nexus.xwiki.org in the /  
14:52 <Denis> true, you could use my scripting doc api to do so :)  
14:54 <Denis> what is curious to  me is that this <url> has a influence on the javadoc generated, but here is no real standard about that  
14:55 <tmortagne> Pbas: try again  
14:55 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
14:55 <tmortagne> looks like global users did not had right to edit anything on extensions.xwiki.org  
14:56 <Pbas> Yes i's working fine now. Thxs :)

18:06 <vmassol> thanks
